solution_line_template: He does the long drive {total_days_in_week}-{short_drive_days}=<<{total_days_in_week}-{short_drive_days}={long_drive_days}>>{long_drive_days} days a week

So he drives a total of {short_drive_days}*{short_drive_miles}+{long_drive_days}*{long_drive_miles}=<<{short_drive_days}*{short_drive_miles}+{long_drive_days}*{long_drive_miles}={weekly_miles}>>{weekly_miles} miles a week
That means the car cost {weekly_miles}*{cost_per_mile}=$<<{weekly_miles}*{cost_per_mile}={weekly_mileage_cost}>>{weekly_mileage_cost} just for the mileage per week
So he pays {weekly_fee}+{weekly_mileage_cost}=$<<{weekly_fee}+{weekly_mileage_cost}={total_weekly_cost}>>{total_weekly_cost} per week for the car
That means the total cost of the car is {total_weekly_cost}*{weeks_per_year}=$<<{total_weekly_cost}*{weeks_per_year}={annual_cost}>>{annual_cost} a year
